meanings.definition: A person who is idle or lazy.
meanings.sent1: The lorner sat on the couch all day without doing anything productive.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a lorner and help with the chores around the house.
meanings.sent3: The lorner decided to take a nap instead of helping with the group project.
meanings.sent4: His brother called him a lorner for always avoiding work like a sloth.
meanings.sent5: The lorner's laziness was so extreme that even the cat seemed more active.

meanings.definition: To act in a lazy or idle manner.
meanings.sent1: She chose to lorner around instead of completing her assignments.
meanings.sent2: Please don't lorner when there are important tasks to be done.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to lorner through the entire class, much to the teacher's dismay.
meanings.sent4: He would rather lorner than make an effort to improve his situation.
meanings.sent5: The sun was shining outside, but he continued to lorner indoors, wasting the day away.
